name: places/ChIJgT-tAg9ZwokRhOQ0Z0AkydI
formattedAddress: 345 E 37th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 345 E 37th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
I was referred to this and one other pain specialist and I chose to see this doctor first. He wrote a book called "Your Pain Is Real". One topic in the book is about using hypnosis for pain management. Dr Hiesiger had me huge doses of Gabapentin, vicotrophin and at one point, a fentanyl patch. I am a petite women and honestly, I don't know how I functioned. I was frustrated because nothing was working that didn't also  make me feel like a zombie. I ended up in the hospital because I couldn't catch my breath. I thought I was having a heart attacks bug He later told me that this was a side effect of a drug he had me on.  I asked him about hypnosis and he laughed at me. The last straw was after he'd been out  recuperating from I believe a heart procedure. He looked at me and said,"Oh you're the one who wants to be perfect." At that point, I went to the other doctor my doctor had recommended and he was wonderful. I saw him for 20 years until he retired. He didn't laugh at hypnosis, he referred me to a therapist who used hypnosis and meditation in her practice. and who helped me reduce my medication by a lot. I don't know how I would be doing if I had not stopped seeing Dr.Hiesiger and switched to the highly caring, dedicated doctor who has treated me all these years.

make me feel like womb

originalText.text:
The poor review must not be from an actual patient? A nationally renowned surgeon crippled me with a surgical error. We visited numerous top surgeons from coast to coast in this country. No one offered any hope or answers. I was at the point of knowing dying would be easier than living 24/7 in pain beyond description. And, yes, I was subjected to all the latest implanted medical gadgets, outward braces, extensive rehabs, psychiatric treatments. Implanted gadgets failed before I could even leave the surgeon’s offices; outward devices helped minimally; rehab was painful but I gained the strongest musculature possible to support my injuries; one psychiatrist felt lithium was the answer although within 2 weeks my thyroid gland began to fail from the drug I did not need; my last psychiatrist took one look at the long list of medications I had collected during this horrific journey, immediately changing the protocol helping me lose the extra 50 lbs I had accumulated simply because many prescribers don’t understand women gain weight with many drugs that men do not. She, in essence, removed a 350 lb backpack I was carrying every single day over a severely compromised spine because  for each pound you are overweight, you add 7 pounds of pressure to your back.

My journey took 4 years to finally find this genius, Dr. Hiesiger.
I am 15 years, so far, without needing a wheelchair. Dr. Hiesiger restored my body, my mind, my soul. Don’t make judgements on “ stars”. Make your decisions on actual stories of patients who found the answers to keep living.

My gratitude for Judy, Sandra, his staff, and those sheer magical medical assistants who appear during surgeries, is profound. Dr. Saint Louis consulted with every visit, reviewed my case and my films. If one genius can change a lfe, imagine your great fortune when there are two. My thanks to Dr Shaffer at the Hospital for Specialty Surgery for putting me on my Path for Hope.

If you are reading what I have written, you are in my prayers. I’ve been where you are. I know how you are feeling in this moment. Hope can last forever if you just do not let go of it. And Hope is our path to Help.

originalText.text: Words cannot adequatley describe the gratitude that I have for Dr. Hiesiger he saved my life! 15 years ago I was crippled with a horrific spinal fusion that went horribly wrong, Dr. Hiesiger & Dr. Benjamin gave me a quality of life that I never dreamed was possible.  You will not find a more competent & compassionate doctor in the entire East Coast. Dr. Hiesiger has dedicated his life to giving patients like me a quality of life that truly is worth living. I read the other review on this site & it couldn't be farther from the truth, Dr. Hiesiger has always treated me with such class & dignity not to mention his procedures and aftercare changed my life in such a positive way that I could never thank him enough. If you have back issues or nerve pain pain of any kind see Dr. Hiesiger he is simply the best at his craft! Also his staff is as good as he is Sandra & Judy keep that office running smoothly :-)

originalText.text: Dr Hiesiger, is one of the most gifted and skilled doctors I have been treated by. I have many doctors in my family and this is truly an exceptional man. He saw me through RSD with knowledge and compassion. Dr Hiesiger is a "gentleman" and I can pay no man, a finer compliment.

originalText.text:
Dangerous, self absorbed, lack of credibility, dismissal from major
institution , threatening when confronted with the absurdity of his
misrepresentations....after 23 plus years,  I have observed his decline
but learned too late of his latent penchant for creating difficulty for
those who challenge his credibility.
